topic_metadata.title: Has anyone seen a Zotero to Hyagriva plugin?

posts.name: Daniel Cook
posts.cooked:
Title says it all.

Currently I used betterbibtex plugin for Zotero to export a biblatex file. I wonder if there is something similar but in hyagriva format.

More information, I use a command in my makefile to curl the server from Zotero/betterbibtex and it gives me the result in biblatex format. Would be nice to have a tool that does this in hyagriva format.

I tried searching online. Online search is bad now.
posts.raw:
Title says it all.

Currently I used betterbibtex plugin for Zotero to export a biblatex file. I wonder if there is something similar but in hyagriva format.

More information, I use a command in my makefile to curl the server from Zotero/betterbibtex and it gives me the result in biblatex format. Would be nice to have a tool that does this in hyagriva format.

I tried searching online. Online search is bad now.

posts.name: Laurenz Mädje
posts.cooked: You could convert the biblatex to hayagriva using hayagriva’s CLI. I’m not aware of a direct exporter for Zotero.
posts.raw: You could convert the biblatex to hayagriva using [hayagriva's CLI](https://github.com/typst/hayagriva?tab=readme-ov-file#installation). I'm not aware of a direct exporter for Zotero.

posts.name: Daniel Cook
posts.cooked: Thank you. I prefer using hayagriva’s cleaner yaml format. I can easily add this to my makefile.
posts.raw: Thank you. I prefer using hayagriva's cleaner yaml format. I can easily add this to my makefile.
